tags: i love the nerd who sent this ask
summary: GOT characters as ur friends??? Do it.
question: GOT characters as ur friends??? Do it.
answer:
I’m going to make one of these with, like, a full list in a little bit but off the top of my head:

  • Margaery Tyrell - Amelia. Eye for beauty in clothes, in art, and in nature, good at making and keeping friends, high key athletic but so chill you wouldn’t notice it. Also sometimes Bossy, as befits a queen.
  • Arianne Martell - Eva. Willing and able to fight for her rights as the (honorary) oldest sibling, has at least 2 people in love with her at all times and has no idea, smarter than people give her credit for. Big Temper, impulsive, and not hugely for social justice unless she can see the effects on her.
  • Daenerys Targaryen - Lilli. Short. Also, passionate about everything she’s interested in, loves animals, Big Empathy, pretty hair. Hates when it’s hot and not the biggest fan of new food, and would rather wear comfy clothes than pretty ones

summary: Just wanted to thank you for all your Dany metas and how you are completely unapologetic in stanning her.
question: Just wanted to thank you for all your Dany metas and how you are completely unapologetic in stanning her.
answer:
asfgjkasflljkll!!
Thank you for this kind message!

Also, Dany makes it very easy.

She might be the least problematic character I stan. (Like, literally, the reason why my sister doesn’t like Dany is because “she’s too good and perfect. and she doesn’t have an evil side”. My sis would probably die laughing if she saw half of the fandom discourse on tumblr.)

And the way GRRM has written her, it’s very easy to defend her.

tags: sorry if my answer came out too salty... but i have had a rough week and i have no patience right now
the more i stay the more i want to leave this fandom
summary: Daenerys attracts white feminists and white supremacists because she's a white savior, according to some people. How would you...
question: Daenerys attracts white feminists and white supremacists because she's a white savior, according to some people. How would you respond to this charge,?
answer:
I wouldn’t respond, I guess?

I mean, it’s the internet… people can say crazy stuff.

I can say that Ned Stark attracts serial killers and Red Queen apologists with all the remorseless “off-with-their-heads” brand of justice he is keen on. I can say that Jon Snow attracts kidnappers and child trafficking mafia, as he is successful in separating babes from their mothers.

I can say all sort of crazy shit….  But it doesn’t make it true.

Also, I think Dany attracts “white supremacists” is an argument that you would only find in dumblr… Because I don’t think any white supremacist is gonna like the only character who abolishes slavery, treats slavers with the motto of “an eye for an eye”, has best friends and closest allies who are poc and woc, has literally married poc characters, etc. 

I am pretty sure white supremacists would be more interested in characters who are white, has little to no representation of poc among their friends/allies, is a part of an incredibly closed-off paternalistic community, has had only white love-interests/spouses, and is wary of “foreigners” and “foreign-whores”. Hmmmmmmm….. I cannot for the life of me think which character(s) would fit that bill?

As for white feminism… Tumblr has a weird definition of it.

Tumblr’s definition is this: any time a white woman stands in solidarity with fellow women (of different race) and does not allow men of colour to treat women like shit, it is “white feminism”.

It is incredibly telling that it is the one character who actively deals with issues of slavery, who has a fairly large number of poc in her council, who has sexual & romantic partners who are poc, who is fighting against rape (especially as a war crime), who actively has poc characters supporting and hoping for her success, who listens to the concerns of poc characters… it is that character —  dany — that is dubbed as “white feminist”.

Meanwhile, there is a slew of characters who couldn’t give any less of a fuck about poc characters who are regarded as “pure cinammon rolls” or as “Good King/Queen”.

¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Fandom hypocrisy at its best!

I have become sort of numb at this point.

But, in case you wanted a more serious answer, you could check out some of my older posts:

Why I being an Indian Feminist would support Daenerys

Daenerys Targaryen and White Saviour Trope

Daenerys Targaryen and Colonialism

House TargARYAN and White Supremacy

Dothraki are rapists/murders that Evil!Dany has brought into the realm (but somehow the Freefolk are not?)

How Daenerys assimilates into cultures she’s exposed to

Somehow House Stark is never “colonialist” or “white imperialist” despite doing the same things Dany/House Targaryen did

I hope this helps!

blog.name: nightqueendany
blog.title: The Daenerys Defense
blog.description: Hi, I'm Lauren. I'm a Santa Cruzian. Yes as in Banana Slugs. Yes, as in the tee-shirt John Travolta wears in Pulp Fiction. I'm a GOT fan. Daenerys stan. I try to be diplomatic but sometimes swear words come out. Deal with it.  Sideblog for asks: asknightqueendany.tumblr.com

summary: Why Daenerys is the only one who should rule the Seven Kingdoms:  One of the critiques I’m constantly seeing against Daenerys is...
body:
Why Daenerys is the only one who should rule the Seven Kingdoms:

One of the critiques I’m constantly seeing against Daenerys is that she isn’t “owed” the Iron Throne, when she supposedly thinks she is, because her family was overthrown.

I have seen posts that go even further - in an attempt to be diplomatic - that say that the Iron Throne shouldn’t even exist, that either the Kingdoms should be split and left to rule themselves OR the people should be allowed to rule themselves as in elect their own leaders rather than continue with the system of monarchy they currently have.

And to both of those points, I really have to just sit back and scratch my head at the mental gymnastics these people have to get through to one 1) argue for the points above and 2) also say they don’t think Daenerys should rule.

Why?

Because Daenerys Targaryen is the ONLY leader in the Seven Kingdoms who would begin the change of taking the country from stale corrupt monarchy to progressive and inclusive democracy.

Cersei and Tywin are (were) always going on about family and dynasty whereas Daenerys knows (or thinks she knows) that she can never have that. The Targaryen line ends with her. The closest she could get to keeping with a traditional monarchy would be to marry someone who already has children and name her adopted children her heirs OR she could just adopt a few orphans herself and name them her heirs.

We’ve already seen Daenerys grant one Kingdom it’s freedom in exchange for their support of her claim to the Iron Throne - the Iron Islands. When Tyrion bristled at this, Daenerys reminded him that Yara wasn’t demanding the freedom of the Ironborn, she was asking, and said that the others are free to ask as well.

Now, some people may scoff at this and say, well, if Dany is just planning on giving away the entire country and letting them all rule themselves, what is the point?

And again, I have to laugh at the sheer amount of canon antis have to ignore here.

Before Dany shook Yara’s hand in alliance, she made Yara swear to uphold the integrity of the Seven Kingdoms. The Ironborn would keep to themselves and cease their ways of reaving and raping along the coast of Westeros. Presumably if Yara didn’t stay true to her word, there would be hell to pay from Dany because we know what she does to people who attack her allies and the innocent.

It would likely be the same with the rest of the Kingdoms if they asked for their freedom. Dany would have certain conditions in place when granting each Kingdom their freedom. Likely there would be an agreement of peace with the rest of Westeros and possibly assurances that the smallfolk would be protected and represented in some way so the high lords could no longer exploit them.

I know there’s been a little debate recently about whether Dany would actually have granted the other Kingdoms their freedom but I think the fact that Daenerys stopped asking Jon to bend the knee to her is proof that she would. She no longer cared about ruling the North, she just wants it safe. Also, I think the fact that Jon told Daenerys he wasn’t her enemy played a role in this as well. She learned much about his character during his stay on Dragonstone and saw that he 1) had no interest in the Iron Throne and 2) his people had chosen him, meaning he likely would be a fair and just ruler - not someone who wanted to take control of the North/Vale just because he could. Jon wasn’t trying to depose Daenerys and he wasn’t at war with her - nor did it seem he would ever go to war with her or with any of the other Kingdoms.

Even though Jon was an opposing ruler, he wasn’t a threat to her or her people and he wasn’t a threat to his own people. So Dany stopped asking him to bend the knee because to her, the North/Vale were in good hands and she had more important things to think about - like saving the rest of Westeros from Cersei.

And so far as potentially changing Westeros from monarchy to democracy - what other ruler has ever had this notion before? What other ruler has put forth the idea to let people chose their own leaders (as Daenerys did in Meereen)? No one. No one on the scale we’re talking. Yes the Night’s Watch has an election. Yes the Iron Islands have a kind of election. Yes Beric was “chosen” to lead the Brotherhood without banners. But none of that equals Westeros becoming a democracy.

Even Jon being named KITN isn’t democratic. 1) there was no one there to “run against” him and 2) Lyanna Mormont’s words prove the North isn’t ready democracy: “We know no King but the King in the North who’s name is Stark.” Well, what if Jon’s first born son and heir is a little shit like Joffrey? What do the Northmen do then?

And even though Jon was essentially “chosen” as KITN, it wasn’t entirely because of Jon’s honor, bravery, leadership skills, etc. I mean, yes, those things played a factor - I think it made it easier for the Northerners to accept Jon as King even though he was a bastard because they at least knew he would be good at it. But what played an even bigger factor was that Jon was Ned’s eldest male child, as Lyanna says, “Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins.” If Jon hadn’t been the bastard of Ned Stark and instead was just a childhood friend of Sansa’s - like Theon or someone - and had helped her take back the North and had helped bring people to her side - the wildlings, etc. would Jon still have been named King? Absolutely not.

Daenerys is the only one with the vision of democracy (we’ve seen this proven in Meereen), she’s the only one with the motivation for democracy (she doesn’t have an heir), and she’s the only one who doesn’t place importance on House and nobility and birth.

If someone not Dany were named ruler of the Seven Kingdoms - Jon or Sansa for instance - there’s no guarantee they would change the system to be more inclusive and friendly to the smallfolk. Everyone else aside from Dany seems happy with the status quo and the status quo, unfortunately, is not what’s best for the people.

reblog.comment:
Why Daenerys is the only one who should rule the Seven Kingdoms:

One of the critiques I’m constantly seeing against Daenerys is that she isn’t “owed” the Iron Throne, when she supposedly thinks she is, because her family was overthrown.

I have seen posts that go even further - in an attempt to be diplomatic - that say that the Iron Throne shouldn’t even exist, that either the Kingdoms should be split and left to rule themselves OR the people should be allowed to rule themselves as in elect their own leaders rather than continue with the system of monarchy they currently have.

And to both of those points, I really have to just sit back and scratch my head at the mental gymnastics these people have to get through to one 1) argue for the points above and 2) also say they don’t think Daenerys should rule.

Why?

Because Daenerys Targaryen is the ONLY leader in the Seven Kingdoms who would begin the change of taking the country from stale corrupt monarchy to progressive and inclusive democracy.

Cersei and Tywin are (were) always going on about family and dynasty whereas Daenerys knows (or thinks she knows) that she can never have that. The Targaryen line ends with her. The closest she could get to keeping with a traditional monarchy would be to marry someone who already has children and name her adopted children her heirs OR she could just adopt a few orphans herself and name them her heirs.

We’ve already seen Daenerys grant one Kingdom it’s freedom in exchange for their support of her claim to the Iron Throne - the Iron Islands. When Tyrion bristled at this, Daenerys reminded him that Yara wasn’t demanding the freedom of the Ironborn, she was asking, and said that the others are free to ask as well.

Now, some people may scoff at this and say, well, if Dany is just planning on giving away the entire country and letting them all rule themselves, what is the point?

And again, I have to laugh at the sheer amount of canon antis have to ignore here.

Before Dany shook Yara’s hand in alliance, she made Yara swear to uphold the integrity of the Seven Kingdoms. The Ironborn would keep to themselves and cease their ways of reaving and raping along the coast of Westeros. Presumably if Yara didn’t stay true to her word, there would be hell to pay from Dany because we know what she does to people who attack her allies and the innocent.

It would likely be the same with the rest of the Kingdoms if they asked for their freedom. Dany would have certain conditions in place when granting each Kingdom their freedom. Likely there would be an agreement of peace with the rest of Westeros and possibly assurances that the smallfolk would be protected and represented in some way so the high lords could no longer exploit them.

I know there’s been a little debate recently about whether Dany would actually have granted the other Kingdoms their freedom but I think the fact that Daenerys stopped asking Jon to bend the knee to her is proof that she would. She no longer cared about ruling the North, she just wants it safe. Also, I think the fact that Jon told Daenerys he wasn’t her enemy played a role in this as well. She learned much about his character during his stay on Dragonstone and saw that he 1) had no interest in the Iron Throne and 2) his people had chosen him, meaning he likely would be a fair and just ruler - not someone who wanted to take control of the North/Vale just because he could. Jon wasn’t trying to depose Daenerys and he wasn’t at war with her - nor did it seem he would ever go to war with her or with any of the other Kingdoms.

Even though Jon was an opposing ruler, he wasn’t a threat to her or her people and he wasn’t a threat to his own people. So Dany stopped asking him to bend the knee because to her, the North/Vale were in good hands and she had more important things to think about - like saving the rest of Westeros from Cersei.

And so far as potentially changing Westeros from monarchy to democracy - what other ruler has ever had this notion before? What other ruler has put forth the idea to let people chose their own leaders (as Daenerys did in Meereen)? No one. No one on the scale we’re talking. Yes the Night’s Watch has an election. Yes the Iron Islands have a kind of election. Yes Beric was “chosen” to lead the Brotherhood without banners. But none of that equals Westeros becoming a democracy.

Even Jon being named KITN isn’t democratic. 1) there was no one there to “run against” him and 2) Lyanna Mormont’s words prove the North isn’t ready democracy: “We know no King but the King in the North who’s name is Stark.” Well, what if Jon’s first born son and heir is a little shit like Joffrey? What do the Northmen do then?

And even though Jon was essentially “chosen” as KITN, it wasn’t entirely because of Jon’s honor, bravery, leadership skills, etc. I mean, yes, those things played a factor - I think it made it easier for the Northerners to accept Jon as King even though he was a bastard because they at least knew he would be good at it. But what played an even bigger factor was that Jon was Ned’s eldest male child, as Lyanna says, “Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins.” If Jon hadn’t been the bastard of Ned Stark and instead was just a childhood friend of Sansa’s - like Theon or someone - and had helped her take back the North and had helped bring people to her side - the wildlings, etc. would Jon still have been named King? Absolutely not.

Daenerys is the only one with the vision of democracy (we’ve seen this proven in Meereen), she’s the only one with the motivation for democracy (she doesn’t have an heir), and she’s the only one who doesn’t place importance on House and nobility and birth.

If someone not Dany were named ruler of the Seven Kingdoms - Jon or Sansa for instance - there’s no guarantee they would change the system to be more inclusive and friendly to the smallfolk. Everyone else aside from Dany seems happy with the status quo and the status quo, unfortunately, is not what’s best for the people.

blog.name: thegameofnerds
blog.title: The Game of Nerds
blog.description: Are you obsessed with a fandom, show, movie, or book?  Then you are at the right place!

summary: Top 5 Love Quotes To Make You Realize There's Hope For Everyone This Valentine's Day
title: Top 5 Love Quotes To Make You Realize There's Hope For Everyone This Valentine's Day
body:
Talk Nerdy To Us this Valentines Day!

Valentine’s Day is upon us very soon and what better way to get in the romantic, touchy-feely mood than by counting down the top five most romantic quotes from your favorite nerdy series.

1)

Image source: Deadline

Wade: Listen, I’ve been thinking.

Vanessa: Really?

Wade: About why we’re so good together.

Vanessa: Why is that?

Wade: Well, your crazy matches my crazy, big time. –Deadpool

Maybe not…

View On WordPress

- What is it you would have me see?
- The way the world is made.

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

summary:
Some Nights
My heart’s breaking for my sister and the con that she called love
But then I look into my nephew’s eyes
Man you...
body:
Some Nights

My heart’s breaking for my sister and the con that she called love

But then I look into my nephew’s eyes

Man you wouldn’t believe the most amazing things

That can come from some terrible lies
